content.description: Same start as Highline but past crux, use lower of the two horizontal cracks to reach the ledge on right of main wall.
content.location: Same start as Highline - main weakness on left of main wall.

content.description: Start at the weakness to the left of the left hand wall. Move left to right using matching crimper to move below small roof to right hand jug. Pull up behind large flake and take higher of the two horizontal cracks to the ledge on the right of the main wall. down climb off the right hand ledge.
content.location: Start using left hand side pull on main weakness at the left of the main wall, right hand on crimp, left foot on block and right foot on polished bump.

content.description: On the left wall, locate the white angling flake/crack that forms a beak near the top. This what you are dynoing to. Start crouched with your right hand in an undercling in the crack, your left hand on a small crimp on the sloping ledge. Make the long dyno to the top of the flake.
content.location: Locate the white angling flake/crack that forms a beak near the top. This what you are dynoing to.

content.description: Starts with a left crimper and you dyno up to a pretty solid hold and top off.
content.protection: Pad and spotter if you plan to top it out.
content.location: Just to the right of the low spot on the left wall that's actually making up part of the cliff.

content.description: In the back of the Alcove, on the right hand side of the wall just before you go under the overhanging boulder. Start on crimps and big feet, balance your way up and slightly left using sidepulls and a shallow eyebrow pocket. Mostly small ahnds but big feet. A slightly tricky topout unless you find the hidden incut out left.
content.location: The back wall of the alcove, before you go under the overhanging boulder.

content.description: Very cool little mellow area toward the back of the canyon, there is a cliff wall with boulders on all sides making this spot feel like it's own little enclosed area.
